H0.text: Which Arctic whale has a long, straight, helical tusk extending from its upper left jaw. Beluga Whale

H1.text: Which Arctic whale has a long, straight, helical tusk extending from its upper left jaw. Bowhead Whale

H2.text: Which Arctic whale has a long, straight, helical tusk extending from its upper left jaw. Gray Whale

H3.text: Which Arctic whale has a long, straight, helical tusk extending from its upper left jaw. Narval

A4.text: The narwhal is the only member of the genus Monodon and one of two living representatives of the family Monodontidae.

A5.text: Males of this species have a large (1.5â€“3.0 m) long tusk, which is a protruding left canine thought to function as a weapon, a tool for feeding, in attracting mates or sensing water salinity.
